page.title: 02 Linlithgow's Growth
page.content: { Linlithgow}originally started off many hundreds of years ago as a clump of houses around the Palace.As more people came to live in{Linlithgow} houses were built along the High Street and gradually the population grew.Many of these old houses remain in the High Street and are now listed buildings which means they are preserved by the state because they are historic buildings. In 1977 eight and a half thousand people lived in{Linlithgow }and by 1981 one thousand more people had moved to the town.Since the 1970's {Linlithgow}has grown considerably.In our area many new estates have been built.{Springfield}was begun about 10 years ago and they are still building onto it.Many people who live in {Linlithgow}feel that it is getting too big and would like building ended.
